title: Perico el Perrito y el Río de Leche

content.translation: There once was a very brave puppy named Perico. Perico was small, but his heart was big. He wanted to be a great rescue dog and help everyone in the forest.
content.text: Había una vez un perrito muy valiente llamado Perico. Perico era pequeño, pero su corazón era grande. Él quería ser un gran perro de rescate y ayudar a todos en el bosque.

content.alt: Perico el perrito con una pequeña capa, luciendo heroico en una colina.
content.prompt: A cute, fluffy terrier puppy (Perico) stands proudly on a small, grassy hill. He is wearing a tiny, makeshift cape made of a leaf. The morning sun is rising behind him, creating a warm, golden glow. Children's book illustration style, soft watercolors, simple and charming. No text in the image.

content.translation: One morning, Perico saw something strange. A big, white cloud was moving slowly from the valley. The white cloud began to advance towards the forest. 'Oh no!' thought Perico. 'That looks like a giant river of milk! Someone spilled it! I must rescue that milk!'
content.text: Una mañana, Perico vio algo extraño. Una nube blanca y grande se movía lentamente desde el valle. La nube blanca empezó a avanzar hacia el bosque. '¡Oh, no!', pensó Perico. '¡Parece un río gigante de leche! ¡Alguien la derramó! ¡Debo rescatar esa leche!'

content.translation: Perico had an idea. 'To save all that milk, I need a very big container. I will build a giant square to hold it!' So, his important mission began.
content.text: Perico tuvo una idea. 'Para salvar toda esa leche, necesito un contenedor muy grande. ¡Voy a construir un cuadrado gigante para guardarla!'. Así, su misión importante comenzó.

content.alt: Perico mirando con determinación una espesa niebla blanca en el valle.
content.prompt: A small, cute terrier puppy stands on a hill, looking down into a valley filled with thick, white morning fog. His eyes are wide with alarm and determination. The style is a gentle, storybook watercolor painting. The fog looks soft and mysterious. No text.

content.translation: Soon, Perico met his friend, Coneja Carla the rabbit. 'Carla, quick! Help me!' said Perico. 'Why, Perico? What's wrong?' asked Carla. 'We must build a giant square!' he explained. 'A square? Why?' she asked, confused. 'To rescue all that milk!' Perico pointed with his paw. 'Look! The river of milk continues to advance!' Carla saw the white cloud and, although she was confused, she decided to help. She gathered some long sticks.
content.text: Pronto, Perico se encontró con su amiga, la Coneja Carla. '¡Carla, rápido! ¡Ayúdame!', dijo Perico. '¿Por qué, Perico? ¿Qué pasa?', preguntó Carla. '¡Debemos construir un cuadrado gigante!', explicó él. '¿Un cuadrado? ¿Por qué?', preguntó ella, confundida. '¡Para rescatar toda esa leche!'. Perico señaló con su pata. '¡Mira! ¡El río de leche sigue su avance!'. Carla vio la nube blanca y, aunque estaba confundida, decidió ayudar. Ella recogió unas ramas largas.

content.alt: Perico explicándole su plan a una coneja confundida llamada Carla.
content.prompt: Children's book illustration of a cute puppy (Perico) gesturing wildly with his paws towards a confused-looking bunny (Carla). Carla is holding a few small sticks. They are in a green field with wildflowers. The art style is whimsical and colorful, with soft, rounded shapes. No text in the image.

content.translation: A little later, they met Gato Gustavo the cat. 'Gustavo, we need your help!' shouted Perico. 'We are building a giant square to rescue the river of milk!' Gustavo's eyes went wide. 'Milk? I love milk!' he said. 'Yes! And it's advancing quickly! We must hurry!' said Perico. Gustavo immediately agreed and found some strong vines to tie the sticks together.
content.text: Un poco después, se encontraron con el Gato Gustavo. '¡Gustavo, necesitamos tu ayuda!', gritó Perico. '¡Estamos construyendo un cuadrado gigante para rescatar el río de leche!'. Los ojos de Gustavo se abrieron mucho. '¿Leche? ¡A mí me encanta la leche!', dijo. '¡Sí! ¡Y avanza rápido! ¡Debemos apurarnos!', dijo Perico. Gustavo aceptó inmediatamente y encontró unas lianas fuertes para atar las ramas.

content.translation: The three friends worked hard. They tried to make a big square with the sticks and vines. But their square was wobbly and funny-looking. It did not look strong enough to hold a river of anything.
content.text: Los tres amigos trabajaron mucho. Intentaron hacer un gran cuadrado con las ramas y las lianas. Pero su cuadrado era inestable y de aspecto gracioso. No parecía lo suficientemente fuerte para contener un río de nada.

content.alt: Los tres amigos animales intentando construir un cuadrado gigante con palos y lianas.
content.prompt: A humorous children's book illustration. A puppy (Perico), a rabbit (Carla), and a cat (Gustavo) are tangled in vines and sticks, trying to build a large, very wobbly square frame. Their expressions are a mix of intense effort and confusion. The style is playful and cartoonish, with bright colors and soft shadows. No text.

content.translation: They carried their wobbly square to the edge of a pond, where the white 'milk' was thickest. They didn't know what to do. Then, a voice came from the water. 'What is that strange square for?' It was a beautiful, silvery fish.
content.text: Llevaron su cuadrado inestable hasta la orilla de un estanque, donde la 'leche' blanca era más espesa. No sabían qué hacer. Entonces, una voz salió del agua. '¿Para qué es ese cuadrado tan extraño?'. Era un pez plateado y hermoso.

content.translation: 'Hello! I am Perico the rescuer!' said the puppy. 'We need your permission to put this square in your pond to rescue the milk!' The fish looked at the white air and then at the silly square. He smiled gently. 'My name is Pez Permiso,' said the fish. 'I will permit you to listen to some advice. That isn't milk.'
content.text: '¡Hola! ¡Soy Perico el rescatador!', dijo el perrito. '¡Necesitamos tu permiso para poner este cuadrado en tu estanque para rescatar la leche!'. El pez miró el aire blanco y luego el cuadrado tonto. Sonrió amablemente. 'Mi nombre es Pez Permiso', dijo el pez. 'Y te doy permiso para escuchar un consejo. Eso no es leche'.

content.translation: 'It's not milk?' asked the three friends. 'No,' said Pez Permiso. 'It is called fog. It's just tiny drops of water in the air. It seems to advance, but when the sun gets warm, it will simply disappear.'
content.text: '¿No es leche?', preguntaron los tres amigos. 'No', dijo el Pez Permiso. 'Se llama niebla. Son solo gotitas de agua en el aire. Parece que avanza, pero cuando el sol caliente, simplemente va a desaparecer'.

content.alt: El sabio Pez Permiso hablando con Perico, Carla y Gustavo en la orilla de un estanque con niebla.
content.prompt: A wise, large silver-and-yellow fish with gentle eyes (Pez Permiso) pokes its head out of a calm pond. On the bank, a puppy, a rabbit, and a cat are listening intently, their expressions changing from confusion to understanding. The background is misty with fog, but a ray of sun is starting to break through the clouds. The style is serene and magical, with soft lighting. Storybook art style. No text.

content.translation: And just as the fish said, the sun rose higher in the sky. It became warm, and the white fog slowly vanished into the air. Perico, Carla, and Gustavo looked at their useless square of sticks and started to laugh. They thanked the wise fish and went to play, having learned a valuable lesson.
content.text: Y tal como dijo el pez, el sol subió más alto en el cielo. Hizo calor, y la niebla blanca se desvaneció lentamente en el aire. Perico, Carla y Gustavo miraron su inútil cuadrado de ramas y comenzaron a reír. Dieron las gracias al sabio pez y se fueron a jugar, habiendo aprendido una valiosa lección.

moral.translation: It is better to ask and understand than to act without knowing.
moral.text: Es mejor preguntar y entender que actuar sin saber.
